item.title: Peter add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I am not going to tell you my name, not yet at any rate.' A queer half-knowing, half-humorous look came with a green flicker into his eyes. 'For one thing it would take a long while: my name is growing all the time, and I've lived a very long, long time; so my name is like a story. Real names tell you the story of things they belong to in my language, in the Old Entish as you might say. It is a lovely language, but it takes a very long time saying anything in it, because we do not say anything in it, unless it is worth taking a long time to say, and to listen to." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Peter add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Deserves it! I daresay he does. Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Peter add a quote by Patrick Rothfuss
item.description: "It's the questions we can't answer that teach us the most. They teach us how to think. If you give a man an answer, all he gains is a little fact. But give him a question and he'll look for his own answers." -- Patrick Rothfuss

item.title: Peter add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Peter add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Science is magic that works." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Peter add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Beware of the man who works hard to learn something, learns it, and finds himself no wiser than before." -- Kurt Vonnegut
